text.section:
In a civil action to enforce this title, the Secretary or Board of Appeals and the State may be represented by:
the Attorney General; or
any qualified attorney who:
is a salaried employee of the Secretary or Board of Appeals; and
on recommendation of the Attorney General, is designated to represent the Secretary or Board of Appeals and the State.

A criminal action for violation of any provision of this title or regulation adopted under this title shall be prosecuted by the State's Attorney of the county in which:
the employer has a place of business;
the violator resides; or
the violator has filed for benefits to which the violator was not entitled.
